intro: Gypsophila tatarica, commonly known as the Tatarian baby's-breath, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is a member of the Carnation family (Caryophyllaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, fluffy clusters of white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, elongated leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden borders and floral arrangements. Gypsophila tatarica is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
